text: Dmitry Knyazhevich (, 21 June 1874 - 1918) was an Imperial Russian soldier and Olympic fencer. He competed in the individual foil and team épée events at the 1912 Summer Olympics. He was a member of the Knyazhevich family, which was a Russian family of Serbian origin that included his grandfather Dmitry, a notable writer, and great-uncle Alexander, who served as Minister of Finance under Alexander II. He served in the Russo-Japanese War and later World War I, during which he was promoted to Major General. In 1918 during the Russian Civil War, he was killed in battle against the Bolsheviks. ==References== Category:1874 births Category:1918 deaths Category:Russian male fencers Category:Olympic fencers of Russia Category:Fencers at the 1912 Summer Olympics Category:Russian military personnel killed in action
title: Dmitry Knyazhevich
